entries.action: Grab a quick protein snack now (yogurt, nuts, or a boiled egg) and a glass of water.
Go to the bathroom now.
Adjust one layer now (add or remove).
Fill your cup with tap water and take 3 sips now.
Dim lights, enable Do Not Disturb, taking deep breathing for 1 minute, then go to bed.
3-2-1—stand up now. Ignore cold temperature, Open curtains, sip water, and do a 2-minute stretch.
Take your medication now with water and tap ‘Done’ to log it.
Safety sweep: doors/windows locked, hazards away, child within sight, water/snack ready. Alerts set to ‘important only’.
Put away everything that distracts you. Clean your desk and take a deep breath. Tasks are challenging but you are capable enough!

sections.name: I need to stop addictive behavior

entries.action: Redirect that energy: wash your face & clean up, do push-ups 10 times, and stretch for 2 minutes.
Save and exit the game within 3 minutes. Replace with a 5-minute offline activity like stretching or hydration.
Sit up now. Put your feet on the floor and stand within 1 minute. Bear the cold temperature!
Stop drinking immediately. Drink water and step away from alcohol. If craving, set a 10-minute delay before deciding again.
Put the food aside now. Drink a glass of water and wait 90 seconds before deciding if you’re still hungry.
Lock your phone for 1 minute. Place it out of reach and replace with one short, intentional activity (one household chore, like desk clean-up!).
Check your calendar, notes, or reminders within 2 minutes.
Start with a 1-minute action on the task. Any progress counts.
Do a 3-minute grounding exercise: slow breathing and 5-4-3-2-1 sensory check.
Stop alcohol intake now. Drink water immediately and ensure you are in a safe place.
Pause and journal for 2 minutes. Write one small step to improve or move forward.
Call emergency services now. Move to a safe space immediately.
